result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L. Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason L. Reed is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason L. Reed was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  Sex Offender Registry for life.  Case plan.  May not have contact with minors except as allowed by agent.  Participate in and follow recommendations of sex offender treatment, drug, alcohol, and mental health evaluation.  No contact with Linda R, Irma L, Katie B, Cyndi N, Nicole R, Lucy P, Lindsey P R, and Kirsten R.

Dated February 12, 2019 - IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on September 12, 2018, that: IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of conviction are summarily affirmed. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt is relieved from further representing Jason L. Reed in these appeals.
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: Dated February 12, 2019 - IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

Dated December 5, 2018 - IT IS ORDERED that, as a one-time courtesy, the clerk of this court is directed to provide Mr. Reed, together with a copy of this order, a copy of his October 15, 2018 supplemental petition, which Mr. Reed shall then serve on the Attorney General. Mr. Reed is advised that the clerk of this court is neither required nor authorized to serve papers on his behalf. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the State of Wisconsin's time for filing a response to the petition for review shall commence as of the date of service of Mr. Reed's supplemental petition.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason L. Reed appeared with Attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Ct 3 -   ITC is:  5years, forthwith
ES is: 4 years
TLS is:  9years
Conditions of extended supervision given.  Court costs ordered.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.  Appeal rights given.

Sentence is consecutive to any other sentence.  In cases 14CF900, 15CF956 and 15CF1212 total credit time for days served it 385 days.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  Count 1 - Dismissed by the State.  Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In.  Count 3 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.
State's AMENDED List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery - filed by ADA, Thomas Binger  kmk

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: PT
Arguments heard on State's motions.  Motion to join 14CF900, 15CF956 and 15CF1212 for trial is granted by the court, but the other acts motions are denied.  Case remains on for trial as previously scheduled.

Defendant Jason L. Reed appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:   Atty Celebre has filed a motion to withdraw as counsel due to an ethical conflict. State takes no position.   Court grants motion.   SPD will need to appoint a new attorney.  Time limits tolled for cause.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
filed by Atty Celebre.
to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Atty David Celebre.

Defendant Jason L. Reed appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes: Atty Celebre asks for sequester of witnesses.  ST called witness DA victim witness coordinator Rhonda Bohr; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty .   Atty Binger requests an adjournment of case.  Court takes a short recess to allow for State to locate paperwork.   Back on the record at 1010am.  State is unable to locate paperwork needed today.  State renews request for adjournment; Atty Celebre objects;  Court grants adjournment for cause.   Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 10:15 am.
